title: OFF-GRID GARDEN WATERING SYSTEM | Tank Set Up

tasks.task: Video content involves setting up an off-grid garden watering system using an irrigation ditch and a water tank.
subtasks: Walking through the setup of a 1100-gallon water tank connected to an irrigation ditch.
Gluing PVC pipes and fittings together to connect the tank to the ditch.
Priming PVC joints using a primer before gluing.
Verifying that the system is properly primed by testing the connection.
Explaining the use of a lockable box on the irrigation ditch to control water flow.
Detailing the connection from the ditch to the tank, including the use of a reducer and shut-off valve.
Ensuring the system drains properly to remove debris.
Measuring the fill rate of the tank to estimate water collection efficiency.

tasks.task: Discussing future plans for utilizing the system, such as drip irrigation and potential pump usage.
Setting up Off-Grid Garden Watering System
